item.title: Electric power efficiency - why is increases so fast
item.description:
Electric power efficiency - why is increases so fast

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top How antminers' are made to decrease electric power consumption by half with each new product, like S9 now?

item.title: Storj and Counterparty Create a New Lightning Based Payments Technology - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Storj and Counterparty Create a New Lightning Based Payments Technology - NEWSBTC

Storj along with Counterparty have developed a new payments technology based on Lightning Network to support crypto-asset payments on the Counterparty Network. Storj, the blockchain based decentralized cloud storage services provider has joined forces with Counterparty, a Bitcoin blockchain based smart contract tools provider to create a new payments channel technology.

item.title: Central Bank Digital Currencies Could Boost GDP, Bank of England Says - CoinDesk
item.description:
Central Bank Digital Currencies Could Boost GDP, Bank of England Says - CoinDesk

The Bank of England has released new research suggesting that a central bank-issued digital currency could lead to an increase in gross domestic product (GDP). The conclusions were drawn from the working paper published today that examined how a central bank-backed digital currency (referred to as a CBDC in the paper) could yield macroeconomic benefits, while providing banking regulators a clearer picture of the financial system.

item.title: How did Vitalik Buterin come up with the idea for Ethereum?
item.description:
How did Vitalik Buterin come up with the idea for Ethereum?

Answer: He was involved with Bitcoin project for a long time. He was thinking about bringing his own cryptocurrency and hence brought Ethereum that was named Bitcoin 2.0; Unfortunately the hack destroyed everything. The sentiment towards Ethereum has fallen and people also got to know that it is...

item.title: How are the costs of blockchain mining distributed?
item.description:
How are the costs of blockchain mining distributed?

A small transaction and large transaction have the same "load" on the ledger - however, the implicit tax (inflation as new bitcoins issued to miners, for example) has a percentage cost to the transaction. Does this favor small transactions over large ones? Does this cause undesirable externalities?

item.title: Does global instability benefit Bitcoin? What is the explanation for this phenomenon?
item.description:
Does global instability benefit Bitcoin? What is the explanation for this phenomenon?

Answer (1 of 3): The price of Bitcoin is roughly the inverse of the trust people have in central banks and governments - when people start feeling threatened that something might happen to their money, the price of Bitcoin rises (demand rises, while supply is more or less constant).

item.title: As Race To Offer First Bitcoin ETF Heats Up, New Company Files To Create An Ether ETF
item.description:
As Race To Offer First Bitcoin ETF Heats Up, New Company Files To Create An Ether ETF

In the wake of recent activity in the race to launch a Bitcoin ETF, a newly formed company has filed to create an ETF out of another digital currency, ether.

item.title: EB140 - Manfred Kareer: Bitsquare - The Decentralized Open-Soure Cryptocurrency-Fiat Exchange
item.description:
EB140 - Manfred Kareer: Bitsquare - The Decentralized Open-Soure Cryptocurrency-Fiat Exchange

Exchanges are often criticized as a central point of failure of the cryptocurrency space. This isn't without justification as, in recent years, we have seen a number of exchanges get hacked, robbed, or embezzled by their founders, which is far from insignificant.

item.description: Bitcoin means you need no longer be subject to bad banks or monetary policy. Get Bitcoin, opt out. Wait 10 years. Let's see who's right.
